objects.name: NormalLabel
objects.string: Click to evaluate the height and normal

objects.name: Directions
objects.string:
There is neither noise nor island shapes.
      Press one of the first two buttons.

events.comment:
This example uses a MarchingSquare behavior on each of these objects:
- 1 HeightField contains the heights of the terrain for each point of a grid
- 16 ContourLine contain the exact same thing as HeightField but is used to render the terraces with different colors
- 1 TerrainRangeSizeField and 1 TerrainLowerBoundField are used to constraint the terrain generation to make an island

The behavior documentation has illustrations that help to understand this example.
It can be reached using the help button in the behavior tab from one of the objects.

Create 16 relief contours with a color gradient.
The number of contours can be changed with the ContourCount variable.
The gradient colors are defined in the "Palette" variable.

A different Threshold is set on every ContourLine. This is what allows to draw the terraces.
Switch to the next color gradient

The cell size changes the drawing precision.
A value of 5 gives smooth curved contours where a value of 20 lets show lines.
Reroll the island positions but keep the same noise
Reroll the noise but keep the same island positions
Disable the noise to show the island positions.
Disable the island constraints to show the noise alone.
Evaluate the height at the cursor location

Add 5 hills with random position and size.
The hills will dictate where the land and sea should be.

A height of 4 and an opacity of 0.25 make an actual height of 1.
So, the values are from 0 to 1 and the maximum operation allow stay in this range.

Here, the field name is not indicative to what it does yet.
It would take too much memory to create one field for each calculus step just to give it a good name.
The name should have been "land probability field".

At the end of this event the fields deserve their names.

TerrainLowerBoundField is the lowest value the terrain field will take.
It's from 0 to 0.5, the noise is generated between 0 and 1 and 0.5 is the sea level.
So, around the hill center, the terrain is very likely to be land.

TerrainRangeSizeField is the amplitude that will be given to the noise.
Before the merge with a subtraction, the field was actually the "terrain upper bound field" (it's easier to understand it this way).
It was from 0.25 to 1, under 0.5 there can't be any land.
So, away from the hill center, the terrain will be under the sea.

The 2 offsets from the "Transform" actions can be changed to get a different kind of terrain.
For instance, using 0.5 or more instead of 0.25 will give a lot of reefs because the upper bound would be over the sea level.

The noise generation uses 3 octaves. This can be seen as 3 layers of noise with different zoom.
The frequency double at each layer (lacunary = 2) and the amplitude is halved (persistence = 0.5).
The first octave gives the general shape of the terrain, but alone it looks very smooth.
The 2 other octaves add small perturbations to add finer details to the landscape.
The whole field is set to the median value when the noise is disable to show the hill positions.
Fill the field with noise between 0 and 1.

Stretch the noise between lower and upper bounds.

TerrainLowerBoundField and TerrainRangeSizeField are built in "IslandPositioning" external events.
As the bounds are defined by fields, each point of the field has their own lower and upper bounds.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: add_, @Jurfix
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Additional math functions and constants expressions:
 - Mathematical constants
 - Greatest common factor/Lowest common multiple
 - Factorial
 - Coordinates conversion for polar and isometric systems
 - ToFixed is an expression for specify a limit of decimals places
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExtendedMath
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Additional math functions and constants expressions.

eventsFunctions.description: Returns a term from the Fibonacci sequence.
eventsFunctions.name: Fibonacci

parameters.description: The desired term in the sequence
parameters.name: n

eventsFunctions.description: Calculates the steepness of a line between two points.
eventsFunctions.name: Slope

parameters.description: X value of the first point
parameters.name: x1

parameters.description: Y value of the first point
parameters.name: y1

parameters.description: X value of the second point
parameters.name: x2

parameters.description: Y value of the second point
parameters.name: y2

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a number of one range e.g. 0-1 to another 0-255.
eventsFunctions.name: Map

parameters.description: The lowest value of the first range
parameters.name: min1

parameters.description: The highest value of the first range
parameters.name: max1

parameters.description: The lowest value of the second range
parameters.name: min2

parameters.description: The highest value of the second range
parameters.name: max2

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the value of the length of the hypotenuse.
eventsFunctions.name: Hypot

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the greatest common factor of two numbers.
eventsFunctions.name: Gcf

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the lowest common multiple of two numbers.
eventsFunctions.name: Lcm

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the input multiplied by all the previous whole numbers.
eventsFunctions.name: Factorial

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a polar coordinate into the Cartesian x value.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Polar coordinate to Cartesian X value
eventsFunctions.name: PolarToCartesianX

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a polar coordinate into the Cartesian y value.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Polar coordinate to Cartesian Y value
eventsFunctions.name: PolarToCartesianY

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a isometric coordinate into the Cartesian x value.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Isometric coordinate to Cartesian X value
eventsFunctions.name: IsoToCartesianX

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a isometric coordinate into the Cartesian y value.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Isometric coordinate to Cartesian Y value
eventsFunctions.name: IisoToCartesianY

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the golden ratio.
eventsFunctions.name: GoldenRatio

eventsFunctions.description: Returns Pi ().
eventsFunctions.name: Pi

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.PI;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns half Pi.
eventsFunctions.name: HalfPi

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.PI / 2;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the natural logarithm of e. (Euler's number).
eventsFunctions.name: E

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.E;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the natural logarithm of 2.
eventsFunctions.name: Ln2

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.LN2;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the natural logarithm of 10.
eventsFunctions.name: Ln10

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.LN10;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the base 2 logarithm of e. (Euler's number).
eventsFunctions.name: Log2e

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.LOG10E;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the base 10 logarithm of e. (Euler's number).
eventsFunctions.name: Log10e

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.LOG10E;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns square root of 2.
eventsFunctions.name: Sqrt2

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.SQRT2;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns square root of 1/2.
eventsFunctions.name: Sqrt1_2

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.SQRT1_2;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns quarter Pi.
eventsFunctions.name: QuarterPi

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.PI / 4;

eventsFunctions.description: Rounds a value to a specified number of decimal places.
eventsFunctions.name: ToFixed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Add00
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Expressions for generating Perlin and Simplex noise values (2D or 3D).

For example, pseudo-random worlds can be generated by using the results from a noise expression to modify some properties of grid organized objects.
A *"seed"* allows to generate the same world again later on instead of having to save the whole generated world.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Noise
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Expressions for generating Perlin and Simplex noise values (2D or 3D). Useful for procedural generation.

eventsFunctions.description: 2 dimensional Perlin noise.
eventsFunctions.name: Perlin2

eventsFunctions.description: 3 dimensional Perlin noise.
eventsFunctions.name: Perlin3

eventsFunctions.description: 2 dimensional simplex noise.
eventsFunctions.name: Simplex2

eventsFunctions.description: 3 dimensional simplex noise.
eventsFunctions.name: Simplex3

eventsFunctions.description: The seed is a number used to generate the random noise. Setting the same seed will result in the same random noise generation. It's for example useful to generate the same world, by saving this seed value and reusing it later to generate again a world.
eventsFunctions.name: SetSeed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the noise seed to _PARAM1_

events.inlineCode:
gdjs._extensionNoise.seed = eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("Seed");
gdjs._extensionNoise.seeding(gdjs._extensionNoise.seed);

eventsFunctions.description: Change the base frequency used for noise generation. A lower frequency will zoom in the noise.
eventsFunctions.name: SetFrequency
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the noise frequency to _PARAM1_

events.inlineCode: gdjs._extensionNoise.frequency = eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("Frequency");

eventsFunctions.description: Change the number of octaves used for noise generation. It can be seen as layers of noise with different zoom.
eventsFunctions.name: SetOctaves
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the number of noise octaves to _PARAM1_

events.inlineCode: gdjs._extensionNoise.octaves = eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("Octaves");

eventsFunctions.description: Change the persistence used for noise generation. At its default value "0.5", it halves the noise amplitude at each octave.
eventsFunctions.name: SetPersistence
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the noise persistence to _PARAM1_

events.inlineCode: gdjs._extensionNoise.persistence = eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("Persistence");

eventsFunctions.description: Change the lacunarity used for noise generation. At its default value "2", it doubles the frequency at each octave.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLacunarity
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the noise lacunarity to _PARAM1_

events.inlineCode: gdjs._extensionNoise.lacunarity = eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("Lacunarity");

eventsFunctions.description: The noise seed used for noise generation.
eventsFunctions.name: Seed

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = gdjs._extensionNoise.seed;

eventsFunctions.description: The base frequency used for noise generation.
eventsFunctions.name: Frequency

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = gdjs._extensionNoise.frequency;

eventsFunctions.description: The number of octaves used for noise generation.
eventsFunctions.name: Octaves

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = gdjs._extensionNoise.octaves;

eventsFunctions.description: The persistence used for noise generation.
eventsFunctions.name: Persistence

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = gdjs._extensionNoise.persistence;

eventsFunctions.description: The lacunarity used for noise generation.
eventsFunctions.name: Lacunarity

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = gdjs._extensionNoise.lacunarity;

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Add00, AlanPH, Tristan (Victris Games)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Expressions to convert color values between various formats (RGB, HSV, HSL, named colors) and get colors between 2 others.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ColorConversion
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Expressions to convert color values between various formats (RGB, HSV, HSL, named colors) and get colors between 2 others.

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a hexadecimal string into a RGB string.  Example input: "0459AF"
eventsFunctions.name: HexToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Apply a weighted mean between 2 RGB colors.
eventsFunctions.name: RgbMean

parameters.longDescription: 0 gives the first color, 1 gives the second color
parameters.name: Ratio

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a hexadecimal string.  Example input: "0;128;255"
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHex

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a HSL string.  Example input: "0;128;255""
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHsl

eventsFunctions.description: Converts HSV color values into a RGB string.  Valid input ranges:  H(0 to 360), S(0 to 100), V(0 to 100)
eventsFunctions.name: HsvToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a HSV string.  Example input: "0;128;255"
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHsv

eventsFunctions.description:
Converts a color name into a RGB string.  (Examples: black, gray, white, red, purple, green, yellow, blue)  
Full list of colors: https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp
eventsFunctions.name: NameToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Converts HSL color values into a RGB string.  Valid input ranges:  H(0 to 360), S(0 to 100), L(0 to 100)
eventsFunctions.name: HslToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a color hue (range: 0 to 360) into an RGB color string with 100% saturation and 50% lightness.
eventsFunctions.name: HueToRgb

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
It can be helpful to draw:
* fog of wars
* liquids effects (water, blobs, lava)
* dynamically paint territories
* other effects based on "contour lines"
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MarchingSquares
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow to build a "scalar field" and draw contour lines of it: useful for fog of wars, liquid effects, paint the ground, etc...

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Add to a Shape painter object and use the actions to draw a field. Useful for fog of wars, liquid effects (water, lava, blobs...).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MarchingSquaresBehavior

eventsFunctions.description: Clear the field by setting every values to 0.
eventsFunctions.name: ClearField
eventsFunctions.sentence: Clear the field of _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Flood an area of the field from a given location until a given hight is reached.
eventsFunctions.name: FloodFrom
eventsFunctions.sentence: Flood the field of _PARAM0_ from x: _PARAM2_, y: _PARAM3_, to a maximum of _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: Cap every value of the field to a range.
eventsFunctions.name: ClampField
eventsFunctions.sentence: Clamp the field of _PARAM0_ from: _PARAM2_ to: _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Apply an affine on the field values.
eventsFunctions.name: TransformField
eventsFunctions.sentence: Transform the field of _PARAM0_ with a coefficient: _PARAM2_ and an offset: _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Add a hill to the field.
eventsFunctions.name: AddHill
eventsFunctions.sentence: Add a hill to the field of _PARAM0_ with center: _PARAM2_, _PARAM3_, _PARAM4_, radius: _PARAM5_, opacity: _PARAM6_ using: _PARAM8_

parameters.longDescription: The hill height at the center, a value of 1 or less means a flat hill.
parameters.name: Height

parameters.longDescription: The hill height is 1 at this radius.
parameters.name: Radius

parameters.longDescription: Set to 1 to apply the hill instantly or repeat this action with a lower value to make is progressive.
parameters.name: Opacity

parameters.longDescription: Small values allow quicker process, but can result to tearing. Try values around 8.
parameters.name: CappingRadiusRatio

eventsFunctions.description: Add a disk to the field.
eventsFunctions.name: AddDisk
eventsFunctions.sentence: Add a disk to the field of _PARAM0_ with center: _PARAM2_, _PARAM3_, radius: _PARAM4_ using: _PARAM6_

parameters.longDescription: The spike height is 1 at this radius.
parameters.name: Radius

parameters.longDescription: Small values allow quicker process, but can result to tearing. Try values around 8.
parameters.name: CappingRadiusRatio

eventsFunctions.description: Mask a disk to the field.
eventsFunctions.name: MaskDisk
eventsFunctions.sentence: Mask a disk on the field of _PARAM0_ with center: _PARAM2_, _PARAM3_, radius: _PARAM4_

parameters.longDescription: The spike height is 1 at this radius.
parameters.name: Radius

parameters.longDescription: Small values allow quicker process, but can result to tearing. Try values around 8.
parameters.name: CappingRadiusRatio

eventsFunctions.description: Add a line to the field.
eventsFunctions.name: AddLine
eventsFunctions.sentence: Add a line to the field of _PARAM0_ fom _PARAM2_ ; _PARAM3_ to _PARAM4_ ; _PARAM5_ with trickness: _PARAM6_ using: _PARAM8_

parameters.longDescription: Small values allow quicker process, but can result to tearing. Try values around 8.
parameters.name: CappingRadiusRatio

eventsFunctions.description: Mask a line to the field.
eventsFunctions.name: MaskLine
eventsFunctions.sentence: Mask a line on the field of _PARAM0_ fom _PARAM2_ ; _PARAM3_ to _PARAM4_ ; _PARAM5_ with trickness: _PARAM6_

parameters.longDescription: The spike height is 1 at this radius.
parameters.name: Thickness

parameters.longDescription: Small values allow quicker process, but can result to tearing. Try values around 8.
parameters.name: CappingRadiusRatio

eventsFunctions.description: Apply a given operation on every value of the field using the value from the other field at the same position.
eventsFunctions.name: MergeField
eventsFunctions.sentence: Merge _PARAM0_ with the field of _PARAM2_ using: _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: Update the field hitboxes.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateHitboxes
eventsFunctions.sentence: Update the field hitboxes of _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Draw the field contours.
eventsFunctions.name: DrawField
eventsFunctions.sentence: Draw the field contours of _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the width of the field cells.
eventsFunctions.name: SetCellWidth
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the width of the field cells of _PARAM0_: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the height of the field cells.
eventsFunctions.name: SetCellHeight
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the height of the field cells of _PARAM0_: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Fill outside or inside of the contours.
eventsFunctions.name: SetFillOutside
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fill outside of the contours of _PARAM0_: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the contour threshold.
eventsFunctions.name: SetThreshold
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the contour threshold of _PARAM0_: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the field area bounds.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAreaBounds
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the field area bounds of _PARAM0_ left: _PARAM2_ top: _PARAM3_ right: _PARAM4_ bottom: _PARAM5_

eventsFunctions.description: Area left bound of the field.
eventsFunctions.name: AreaLeft

eventsFunctions.description: Area top bound of the field.
eventsFunctions.name: AreaTop

eventsFunctions.description: Area right bound of the field.
eventsFunctions.name: AreaRight

eventsFunctions.description: Area bottom bound of the field.
eventsFunctions.name: AreaBottom

eventsFunctions.description: Width of the field cells.
eventsFunctions.name: CellWidth

eventsFunctions.description: Height of the field cells.
eventsFunctions.name: CellHeight

eventsFunctions.description: The number of cells on the x axis.
eventsFunctions.name: DimensionX
eventsFunctions.sentence: At _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ the field value of _PARAM0_ is greater than _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: The number of cells on the y axis.
eventsFunctions.name: DimensionY
eventsFunctions.sentence: At _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ the field value of _PARAM0_ is greater than _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: The contour threshold.
eventsFunctions.name: ContourThreshold

eventsFunctions.description: The normal X coordinate at a given location.
eventsFunctions.name: NormalX
eventsFunctions.sentence: At _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ the field value of _PARAM0_ is greater than _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: The normal Y coordinate at a given location.
eventsFunctions.name: NormalY
eventsFunctions.sentence: At _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ the field value of _PARAM0_ is greater than _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: The normal Z coordinate at a given location.
eventsFunctions.name: NormalZ
eventsFunctions.sentence: At _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ the field value of _PARAM0_ is greater than _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the field value at a grid point.
eventsFunctions.name: SetGridValue
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the field value of _PARAM0_ at the grid point _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ to _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: The field value at a grid point.
eventsFunctions.name: GridValue
eventsFunctions.sentence: At _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ the field value of _PARAM0_ is greater than _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: The field value at a given location.
eventsFunctions.name: FieldValue
eventsFunctions.sentence: At _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ the field value of _PARAM0_ is greater than _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the contours are filled outside.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckFillOutside
eventsFunctions.sentence: The contours of _PARAM0_ are filled outside

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a field is greater than a given value.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckFieldValue
eventsFunctions.sentence: At _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ the field value of _PARAM0_ is greater than _PARAM4_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a point is inside the contour.
eventsFunctions.name: ContainsPoint
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ is inside _PARAM0_
